chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Battige was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
May transfer probation to Adams County.

miscConds.notes: Court holds Restitution open for 90 days.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, commencing forthwith. Straight Time. Sentence credit of 49 days were granted. May be served in Adams County.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew J Battige in court, in custody, with Attorney Michael S. Holzman.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is stricken.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Holzman makes statement regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3  YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS     **Transfer allowed to Adams County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  Court holds open for 90 days 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  90 days (49 days credit), STRAIGHT TIME-to commence forthwith (Defendant already in custody)-may be served in Adams County 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 08/12/15 preliminary & arraignment.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Andrew J Battige in court, in custody, with attorney Michael S. Holzman.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. City of Waukesha Police Officer Tyler Bauer sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Brejcha.  Cross examination by Attorney Holzman.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Attorney Holzman moves to dismiss with no argument.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Holzman requests a modification of bail.  State objects to a modification of bail.    The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Battige in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
